SENT.plain: A 58-year-old woman complaining of a mild headache was admitted to our hospital
MRI 3 months before admission revealed a round lesion at the right quadrigeminal cistern
Cerebral angiograms demonstrated a fusiform aneurysm arising from the parietooccipital artery, which is the distal branch of the right posterior cerebral artery
Repeated MRI and cerebral angiograms performed on admission demonstrated complete thrombosis of an aneurysm and the parent artery without any clinical symptoms
This is the first case of complete spontaneous thrombosis of an aneurysm of the distal posterior cerebral artery
The mechanism of its development and spontaneous thrombosis in a fusiform aneurysm is discussed
